message_1:
What is the enthalpy change (in kJ/mol) for the combustion of methane, CH4(g), given the following thermochemical equation:

CH4(g) + 2 O2(g) -> CO2(g) + 2 H2O(l)
ΔHrxn = -890.3 kJ/mol
message_2:
The enthalpy change (ΔH) for the combustion of methane, CH4(g), is given in the thermochemical equation:

CH4(g) + 2 O2(g) -> CO2(g) + 2 H2O(l)
ΔHrxn = -890.3 kJ/mol

This means that the enthalpy change for the combustion of methane is -890.3 kJ/mol.
